encodingDesc.p: This file encoded to comply with EpiDoc Guidelines and Schema version 8 http://www.stoa.org/epidoc/gl/5/

revisionDesc.change: Finalized - Implemented most suggestions, looks fine.
Finalized - Implemented most suggestions, looks fine.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Delete Volume under the first biblio; in the text, implement changes of the reviewer; fine otherwise.
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Delete Volume under the first biblio; in the text, implement changes of the reviewer; fine otherwise.

Vote - Accept-Text-Meta - Some tidying required: in l.1 the scribal circumflex should be over alpha (not iota) of δαιτα; add markup for φ[έροντο] indicating that it is in F and T; the mss. note in l.3 is incorrect, as the pap. has the more common reading (while ἐγὼν ἄορ is attested in H,U,K, and W); in l.4, if iota is subscript on τῷ it should also be subscript on κυανοπρῴροιο; in l.5 the scribal circumflex should be over omicron (not iota) of εμοις; in l.6 the trema is over iota, not upsilon; in l.7 ἅμα is the most common reading; ἅλα is attested in Rhianos and Callistratos; other textual notes involving mss. (re: νεός l.4; ὑπέκ l.6) should be encoded or added to commentary. Metadata: delete vol. # from 95234; note in physical description that 1 column and 7 lines survive. Note also that the rival edition of Mironczuk is more conservative (re: dots) and has a few differences of opinion regarding readings and ancient diacriticals: both editors worked from photographs instead of autopsy.

Note also that the rival edition of Mironczuk is more conservative (re: dots) and has a few differences of opinion regarding readings and ancient diacriticals: both editors worked from photographs instead of autopsy.
